keyPolicies.policyDescription: Working families are warned that they are risking costs of 35,000 during their child's first two years. Labour will introduce plans to help parents left childminding under the Tories. Labour will make work pay by providing 25 hours of childcare for 3 and 4-year-olds.
Labour will raise the minimum wage to 8 an hour over the next five years. We're 1,600 a year worse off. Labour's working family tax credit will help families to get on in life.
Labour will deal with the housing crisis. Labour will make sure that at least 200,000 homes are built a year by 2020.

mentions.candidate: Chris Inchley is your candidate for Wells

issues.economy: Labour will raise the minimum wage to 8 an hour over the next five years. We're 1,600 a year worse off.
issues.health: Labour will create a new future where our pillars are not so safe, so safety can be restored.

housing.content: Families across Britain are struggling with housing because builders aren't building enough houses. Labour will deal with the housing crisis. Under Labour, we will build at least 200,000 homes a year by 2020.

images.caption: Chris Inchley - Labour candidate for WELLS

leaflet.additionalNotes: My pledges to you: Balance the books and cut the deficit every year, Support working parents and ensure fairness in our tax system, Secure the future of our NHS with 36,000 more frontline staff, Get young people back to work, Abolish the Bedroom Tax.
